articles.description: Australia bowl out West Indies for just 27 - the second lowest score in Test history, and the worst since 1955 - to complete a 176-run win.
articles.title: West Indies score 27 as Australia's Mitchell Starc takes quickest five-wicket Test haul

articles.description: Jofra Archer says it was "long" road back to Test cricket, but his performance is hugely encouraging for his and England's future, writes Matthew Henry.
articles.title: England vs India: Jofra Archer reflect on 'long' road back to Test cricket - how did he perform?

articles.description: The Club World Cup is seen by many as a dress rehearsal for the 2026 World Cup host - so what have we learned now it's over?
articles.title: Club World Cup: What have we learned ahead of 2026 World Cup?

articles.description: Iga Swiatek and Jannik Sinner have won the Wimbledon singles titles having served drugs bans within the past year. Dan Roan explores what it means for tennis.
articles.title: Iga Swiatek and Jannik Sinner: From drugs bans to Wimbledon champions - how did we get here?

articles.description: Britain's Simon Yates wins stage 10 of the Tour de France on Bastille Day as Ben Healy becomes the first Irish rider to claim the yellow jersey for 38 years.
articles.title: Tour de France 2025 results: Yates wins stage 10 as Ireland's Healy takes yellow

articles.description: Newcastle are exploring a record deal for Eintracht Frankfurt striker Hugo Ekitike.
articles.title: Hugo Ekitike: Newcastle explore record deal for Eintracht Frankfurt striker

articles.description: English putting coach Phil Kenyon discusses his work with Scottie Scheffler and the adjustments the pros need to make when putting on links greens at this week's Open Championship.
articles.title: The Open at Royal Portrush: How Scottie Scheffler's putting fortunes were turned around

articles.description: England captain Ben Stokes says he never thought about stopping during his mammoth bowling spells that helped seal the third Test win over India at Lord's.
articles.title: England vs India: Ben Stokes draws on previous 'dark places' to set up Lord's victory

articles.description: Rory McIlroy says he is ready to embrace playing a home Open Championship and is happy to "have another crack" at Royal Portrush after missing the cut in 2019.
articles.title: The Open 2025: Rory McIlroy says Portrush win would be 'just as emotional' as Masters triumph

articles.description: With 50 days to go until the Premier League transfer window closes, clubs have spent more money at this stage of a summer than ever before.
articles.title: Premier League transfer spending exceeds £1 billion, with 50 days of window to go
